thread.title: ALCS Game 6 preview: Blue Jays try to keep season alive vs. Royals - MLB
thread.title_full: ALCS Game 6 preview: Blue Jays try to keep season alive vs. Royals - MLB - SI.com

author: Cliff Corcoran
title: ALCS Game 6 preview: Blue Jays try to keep season alive vs. Royals - MLB
text:
by Cliff Corcoran Twitter Email Posted: Fri Oct. 23, 2015 The Blue Jays avoided elimination in Game 5 of the American League Championship Series with a 7–1 win . Marco Estrada 's dominant start on Wednesday not only saved Toronto’s season, it also bought the Jays a crucial day off that could further slow Kansas City’s momentum, and it gave his team's bullpen a chance to regroup after a disastrous Game 4. As positive as all of that may have been for Toronto, however, the Royals could still end the series tonight.
• MORE MLB: Full postseason schedule, start times, TV listings
Blue Jays at Royals
Series: ALCS Game 6; Royals lead 3–2
Start Time: 8:07 p.m. ET
TV: FOX Sports 1
Starting Pitchers: David Price (1–2, 7.02) vs. Yordano Ventura (0–1, 6.57 ERA)
• This is the 98th best-of-seven postseason series in the World Series era (1903-present) to reach a sixth game. Of the first 97, the team trailing 3–2 forced a Game 7 52 times and came back to win the final two games—and thus the series—29 times. That’s 54% and 30%, respectively, slightly better than coin-flip odds. Of the 29 teams to come all the way back and win the series, 10 did so by winning the final two games on the road; the 2004 Red Sox were the last to do it, taking Games 6 and 7 at Yankee Stadium in their famous comeback from a 3–0 deficit in the ALCS.
MLB Video Estrada shines and now Price must do the same to keep Blue Jays alive by Tom Verducci
